page.title: 17VILLAGE SHOPS IN BIBURY
page.content: There are seven shops in Bibury that cater for both tourists and residents. They are all small and run by their owners who often live 'over' the shop. Four depend heavily on tourists as they sell meals, teas, antiques and gifts. Two are open throughout the year; the others close during the winter months. These 'tourists' shops mostly rely on part-time employees to cater for the changing demand. The other three shops include the two general stores (the post office and the paper shop) and a clothes shop. These are open all year and have full time staff. They are important for the local people but have to compete with the greater choice available in Cirencester. Three mobile shops visit the village each week. One sells wet fish, one greengroceries and the third is a general store.
